newsitem.title: USA: CarMax acquires Atlanta new car dealership.
newsitem.headline: CarMax acquires Atlanta new car dealership.

text.p: CarMax Auto Superstores Inc said that it will acquire Bob Maddox Chrysler-Plymouth Atlanta Inc and relocate the franchise to its new Southlake CarMax Superstore in Jonesboro, Ga., scheduled to open in June.
The company said that the acquisition would be in cash, subject to the manufacturers approval. Terms were not disclosed.
CarMax, a subsidiary of Circuit City Stores Inc said that the acquisition is one of the first steps in a strategy that will add new-car franchises to numerous locations.

CarMax has begun a national expansion plan that includes a total of 80 to 90 Superstore locations over the next five years. The retailer, which began operations selling used-cars, said it expects to expand its consumer offer with new-car franchises wherever possible.
